news.title: MetaMask Security Monthly: May 2024
news.subtitle: 2024 is flying by! See the latest on Smart Transactions and Snaps, and wish a not-so-fond farewell to Pink Drainer.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Father of the videogame cartridge Gerald ‚ÄúJerry‚Äù Lawson

ü¶ä What We‚Äôve Been Up To ü¶ä


Introducing Smart Transactions

Transaction inefficiencies aren't always necessarily a security matter, but they can cost our users money and we don't like that. So this month, MetaMask unveiled Smart Transactions that can deliver a 99.5% transaction success rate, MEV protection, pre-simulation, and improved gas settings. As our Executive Product Director Gal Eldar put it:

‚ÄúAt MetaMask, we believe that wallets are uniquely positioned‚Äîand in many ways responsible‚Äîfor addressing these user pain points head-on. The creation of Smart Transactions serves as our commitment to take an even more active role in tackling some of these challenges and to continue innovating at new layers of the wallet experience as part of our efforts to make the process of submitting transactions not just easier and safer but also more efficient and predictable for everyone. Democratizing access to decentralized technologies is a long and winding journey, and Smart Transactions are an important and bold step toward this end.‚Äù

User Guide: Secret Recovery Phrase, Password, and Private Keys

In our continuous quest to educate our users, this recent support article co-authored by Oliver Renwick and Joel Willmore is aimed at teaching newcomers tips to avoid getting themselves rekt. If you have people in your life who are interested in getting their web3 feet wet, point them to the resources we have available at https://support.metamask.io/.

üéôÔ∏è MetaMask in the Security Ecosystem üîé


MetaMask Snaps, Security and Due Diligence

Christian Montoya is at it again! Check out the X Space he co-hosted with HAPI to discuss how Snaps enables innovation that makes users more secure.

‚ÄúOne of the most important things is that security is multifaceted and what that means is that there's lots of different stages within your journey as a user in web3 ... where security products are needed. Usually, when people talk about security, they'll talk about one specific area, like 'get a hardware wallet.' A hardware wallet is great but it doesn't protect you if you sign something on a dapp that gives [a bad actor] access to your assets. You can still get drained from a hardware wallet if you interact with a malicious dapp ... At MetaMask we're focused on bringing on security providers and shipping solutions in lots of different areas.‚Äù

The Snaps Directory is growing all the time! Click here to see a full list of Security Snaps.

Meanwhile‚Ä¶


Pink Drainer Shuts Down

Pink Drainer, a notorious crypto wallet drainer, amassed over $85 million by exploiting around 20K victims through sophisticated phishing schemes. Pink Drainer recently announced they are shutting down citing: ‚ÄúWe have reached our goal and now, according to plan, it's time for us to retire.‚Äù Despite Pink Drainer's end, the threat of similar operations looms. Pink Drainer wrote, ‚ÄúIt is very likely that our retirement will have no major impact on the scene, people will move on to other drainers just as quickly as they moved to us.‚Äù

Although Pink Drainer is retiring, there are still other popular active wallet drainers. Keeping substantial funds in hardware wallets is highly recommended, while wallets used for daily transactions should contain only minimal assets. Taking these steps can help safeguard against the loss of substantial cryptocurrency holdings. Using different accounts for different transactions based on the level of risk can also mitigate against potential damages.

üö®üí∞ According to @zachxbt, Pink Drainer is shutting down after siphoning off over $75M from around 20k victims in just a year. pic.twitter.com/eg1AUjHJwl

— Scam Sniffer | Web3 Anti-Scam (@realScamSniffer) May 17, 2024

‚ö†Ô∏è Tales of Caution ‚ö†Ô∏è


Lazarus(APT-Q-1) Secret Stealing Operation


Summary

Lazarus, an APT group, has been active since 2007, gaining notoriety for its 2014 Sony Pictures attack. Initially focusing on government agencies to steal intelligence, it shifted in 2014 towards targeting global financial institutions and virtual currency trading venues, engaging in the theft of money and assets. The group has employed phishing attacks through fake social accounts that offer bogus job opportunities to individuals in specific industries. Recently, security researchers uncovered a series of attacks involving ZIP files with malicious JS code targeting blockchain developers through job postings on platforms like LinkedIn, Upwork, and Braintrust. These attacks, consistent with Lazarus's "Contagious Interview" campaign, involve tricking candidates into running malicious code that steals crypto-related information and implants malware.

How Users Can Protect Themselves

To protect against phishing and malware attacks like those executed by groups such as Lazarus, it's crucial to verify the legitimacy of unexpected job offers through independent research and to maintain robust digital hygiene. This includes using up-to-date anti-virus and anti-malware software, enabling multi-factor authentication (MFA) for an added layer of security, and exercising caution with email attachments and links from unknown sources. Additionally, keeping all software updated is essential to guard against exploitable vulnerabilities. By adopting these practices, individuals can significantly bolster their defenses against sophisticated cyber threats and safeguard their sensitive information

Address Poisoning Attacks on the Rise, leading a recent victim to a $68M Loss


Summary

Address poisoning is a deceptive tactic where attackers manipulate victims' transaction histories to trick them into sending funds to the wrong address. This method involves creating fake tokens, using 'vanity' addresses that closely resemble the target's, and exploiting the ERC-20 token standard's "transferFrom()" function. Attackers employ these strategies to conduct zero-value token transfers and spoofed token transfers, making their fraudulent addresses appear legitimate. These attacks are designed to confuse users into copying the wrong address for their transactions, leading to financial losses. The sophistication of these methods highlights the evolving nature of cyber threats in the blockchain space.

How Users Can Protect Themselves

To protect against address poisoning, users should avoid copying addresses directly from their transaction history and instead, copy them from a trusted source. Implementing domain names for addresses can enhance distinguishability, though users must be cautious of domain name spoofing. Utilizing an address book feature provided by wallet services or adding a private name tag on platforms like Etherscan to whitelist trusted addresses can help users easily identify and avoid spoofed addresses.

nodes.subtitle: Whether you‚Äôre an OG or newbie, the Fox is here to make you more powerful in web3. Here are 10 things you can do today in MetaMask Portfolio.

image.title: 10 Things You Can Do with MetaMask Portfolio

childMarkdownRemark.html:
The MetaMask wallet has been around almost as long as web3 itself. Launched in 2016, the Fox has come a long way since then, guided by a mission to connect as many people around the world to the decentralized internet as possible. And we know connecting is just the start - much more than that MetaMask enables you to buy, sell, swap, bridge, stake, and beyond, and it all starts in Portfolio.

MetaMask Portfolio is where you get a clear, comprehensive view of your accounts and wallets across all networks. It‚Äôs also where your web3 journey begins. Whether you‚Äôve been using MetaMask for years or even minutes, here are ten things you can do in Portfolio right now:

Ten ways MetaMask Portfolio makes you powerful in web3


1. Manage your digital assets and track performance in the dashboard: Easily view and manage all your digital assets including Ethereum tokens (ERC-20) and non-fungible tokens (NFTs), all from a single, unified interface. Keep an eye on your portfolio's performance over time, with insights into asset distribution, historical transactions, and overall value trends. Remember you can view the balances of any public Ethereum address or ENS. You can also view which airdrops you‚Äôre eligible for by using the claim airdrop feature.

How to use the Dashboard on MetaMask Portfolio:




2. Do your taxes: Yes, that‚Äôs correct ‚Äì you can do your crypto taxes directly from Portfolio. All you have to do is connect your wallet and you‚Äôll receive 10% off your tax services with recommended providers like CoinTracker, CoinLedger, ZenLedger, Crypto Tax Calculator, and Koinly:


3. Connect to dapps and explore web3: Access and engage with all the dapps web3 has to offer directly through Portfolio: from decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms like Aave, Uniswap, and Renzo, gaming dapps such as HyperPlay to NFT marketplaces like OpenSea.

4. Swap tokens: Use the built-in swap feature to trade tokens directly within Portfolio, leveraging the best available rates across multiple decentralized exchanges (DEXs).



5. Connect to multiple networks: Beyond Ethereum, MetaMask supports various Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM)-compatible networks, allowing users to switch between networks like Binance Smart Chain, Polygon, Linea, and more.

6. Buy and sell cryptocurrency: Buy cryptocurrencies directly within MetaMask Portfolio using traditional payment methods such as bank transfers or credit cards, and through integrations with third-party providers like Paypal and Revoult. And if you‚Äôre ready to sell, Portfolio has you covered, simply connect your wallet and select your method to cash out.




7. Integrate with your hardware wallet: Enhance your security by connecting MetaMask to hardware wallets like Ledger or Trezor from Portfolio, combining the convenience of MetaMask with the robust security of cold storage.

8. Customize privacy settings: Adjust your privacy settings to your preference, including setting up a custom RPC for specific networks, managing connected sites, and reviewing permissions. Learn more about how to configure your privacy settings here.

9. Participate in staking: Stake your crypto directly through MetaMask Portfolio, participating in the decision-making processes of various protocols and earning rewards. In Portfolio, there are three options for staking, Validator, Pooled, and Liquid. The below tutorials show you how easy it is to start staking based on your preference.




10. Bridge tokens: Bridging tokens on MetaMask refers to the process of transferring digital assets or tokens from one blockchain network to another using MetaMask as the interface for the transaction. Bridging tokens is a powerful feature in Portfolio that enhances the interoperability between different blockchain networks, enabling users to leverage the unique advantages of each network.


Coming soon in Portfolio


Transfer assets from centralized exchanges (CEXs) like Coinbase and Binance directly to your MetaMask wallet, or between different accounts within MetaMask itself, with enhanced security and ease. Stay tuned for this feature coming soon in Portfolio.

MetaMask Portfolio not only simplifies the management of digital assets but also opens up a world of possibilities for users to explore and engage with the decentralized ecosystem, all while maintaining a high level of security and user control. Get started today.

nodes.subtitle: MetaMask Extension's new UI update makes reviewing signature requests simpler and clearer.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
We‚Äôre excited to introduce our latest UI update for MetaMask Extension, aimed at improving the readability of signature requests.

For All Users: Whether you're new to MetaMask or a seasoned user, you'll notice a fresh, more visually pleasing look when receiving signature requests. This update makes it easier to understand and review the actions you're about to approve.

How It Works: Starting with v12.2 of the MetaMask Extension, you'll see the redesigned interface for Permit and Sign In With Ethereum signatures. Don't worry if you don't see changes right away‚Äîwe're rolling this out gradually to ensure a smooth transition.

In the coming months, we'll be extending this new UI to more signatures, transactions, and our Mobile app. Stay tuned for these updates!

To keep up with the latest on this rollout and other updates, follow us on Twitter @MetaMaskSupport and keep an eye on our Support Channel.

Want to Learn More? Dive deeper into the world of MetaMask signatures by checking out our support article.

Embrace clarity and enjoy peace of mind. Happy signing!

nodes.title: MetaMask UX Update: Improved Token Insights
nodes.subtitle: The new update provides a comprehensive understanding of your crypto assets with 24-hour percentage changes and detailed financial data per ERC20 token.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
We are excited to introduce two important enhancements to our token management feature:

  1. 24-Hour percentage changes in token lists
  2. Detailed financial data in token details

Your token lists will now display 24-hour percentage changes, allowing you to quickly assess price trends directly in MetaMask. You can also access detailed financial data, including price charts and market cap information, when you click on your ERC20 tokens.

This is now available in MetaMask Extension and is coming soon to Mobile.

The 24-hour percentage change will be visible in the main asset list view, while detailed financial data can be found by clicking on the specific ERC20 tokens.

Whether you're a seasoned investor or new to crypto, having easy access to price trends and detailed financial information helps you manage your portfolio more effectively. You can learn more about it in our support article.

Stay tuned for further updates. Enjoy!
